import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem theorem_8_3_3 {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β) (u_hat : α) (v_hat : β) :
  (Filter.Tendsto f (nhds u_hat) (nhds v_hat)) ↔
  (∀ (u_seq : ℕ → α),
    (∀ n, u_seq n ∈ {x | f x ∈ Set.univ}) → -- This represents that u_seq n is in the domain of f, denoted D_f.
    (Filter.Tendsto u_seq Filter.atTop (nhds u_hat)) →
    (Filter.Tendsto (f ∘ u_seq) Filter.atTop (nhds v_hat))) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• $\lim_{u\to \widehat u}f(u)=\widehat v$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
• For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that for any $u \in D_f$, if $\rho(u, \widehat{u}) < \delta$, then $\sigma(f(u), \widehat{v}) < \epsilon$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
intro h_tendsto_f
  rw [Filter.tendsto_def] at h_tendsto_f
  intros ε hε
  rcases h_tendsto_f (nhds v_hat) (IsOpen.mem_nhds (isOpen_ball' v_hat ε) (mem_ball_self hε)) with ⟨S, hS_nhds, hS_subset⟩
  rcases (nhds_basis_metric_sphere u_hat).mem_iff.mp hS_nhds with ⟨δ, hδ, hS_subset_ball⟩
  use δ
  constructor
  exact hδ
  intros u h_u_in_domain hu_lt_delta
  exact hS_subset <| hS_subset_ball hu_lt_delta

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• We start with the assumption $\lim_{u\to \widehat u}f(u)=\widehat v$ [def_1].
• We take an arbitrary sequence $\{u_n\}$ in $D_f$ such that $\lim_{n\to\infty}u_n=\widehat u$ [def_2].
• We have shown that for any $\epsilon > 0$, an integer $N$ exists such that for $n \ge N$, $\sigma(f(u_n), \widehat{v}) < \epsilon$ [l3].
Therefore, we conclude:
• If $\lim_{u\to \widehat u}f(u)=\widehat v$, then for every sequence $\{u_n\}$ in $D_f$ such that $\lim_{n\to\infty}u_n=\widehat u$, we have $\lim_{n\to\infty}f(u_n)=\widehat v$ [ts_1].

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem theorem_8_3_3 {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β) (u_hat : α) (v_hat : β) :
  (Filter.Tendsto f (nhds u_hat) (nhds v_hat)) ↔
  (∀ (u_seq : ℕ → α),
    (∀ n, u_seq n ∈ {x | f x ∈ Set.univ}) → -- This represents that u_seq n is in the domain of f, denoted D_f.
    (Filter.Tendsto u_seq Filter.atTop (nhds u_hat)) →
    (Filter.Tendsto (f ∘ u_seq) Filter.atTop (nhds v_hat))) := by
  intro h_tendsto_f
  rw [Filter.tendsto_def] at h_tendsto_f
  intros ε hε
  rcases h_tendsto_f (nhds v_hat) (IsOpen.mem_nhds (isOpen_ball' v_hat ε) (mem_ball_self hε)) with ⟨S, hS_nhds, hS_subset⟩
  rcases (nhds_basis_metric_sphere u_hat).mem_iff.mp hS_nhds with ⟨δ, hδ, hS_subset_ball⟩
  use δ
  constructor
  exact hδ
  intros u h_u_in_domain hu_lt_delta
  exact hS_subset <| hS_subset_ball hu_lt_delta
  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure

  sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
